articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed at least 24 Palestinians in a tent encampment housing displaced families in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip, local health authorities said on Sunday, as mediators hosted a new round of talks between Israel and Hamas.
articles.title: Israel airstrike kills at least 24 in Gaza as mediators host ceasefire talks

articles.author: Alan Charlish
articles.description: Poles vote on Sunday in a presidential election that will decide whether Warsaw follows the pro-European path set by Prime Minister Donald Tusk, or takes a step towards bringing back nationalist admirers of U.S. President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Polish presidential election to test if PM's pro-EU vision is Trump-proof

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's presidential candidates will face off in their first TV debate on Sunday evening ahead of a snap election on June 3 to choose a successor to former President Yoon Suk Yeol, who was impeached over his short-lived martial law declaration in December.
articles.title: South Korea's presidential candidates prepare to face off in first debate

articles.author: Joshua McElwee, Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Crowds are expected to cram St. Peter's Square and surrounding streets in Rome for the formal celebration, which includes Leo's first ride in the white popemobile.
articles.title: Pope Leo to take charge of Catholic Church at grandiose inaugural Mass

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: The round of peace talks in Istanbul lasted one hour and 40 minutes. Hours later, a Russian drone killed nine bus passengers in the Sumy region of northeastern Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia demanded Kyiv pull back troops before ceasefire, Ukrainian source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Five people were killed on Saturday when two helicopters collided and crashed in a wooded area near Eura Airport in southwestern Finland, police said.
articles.title: Five dead in helicopter collision in Finland, police say

articles.author: Luiza Ilie
articles.description: Romanians vote on Sunday in a presidential election run-off that pits a hard-right eurosceptic against a centrist independent, and where the outcome could have implications for both the country's struggling economy and EU unity.
articles.title: Romanians vote in presidential run-off that could widen EU rifts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney on Saturday reaffirmed the country's support for Ukraine in his first face-to-face meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy since winning the election.
articles.title: Canada PM Carney reaffirms support for Ukraine in first meeting with Zelenskiy

articles.author: Catarina Demony, Sergio Goncalves
articles.description: Millions of Portuguese will cast their ballots on Sunday in a third general election in as many years, though many are bracing for more uncertainty as the vote is unlikely to deliver a stable government.
articles.title: Portuguese head to the polls in election unlikely to yield stable government

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. embassy in Libya denied on Sunday a report that the U.S. government was working on a plan to relocate Palestinians from the Gaza Strip to Libya.
articles.title: US embassy in Tripoli denies report of planned relocation of Palestinians to Libya
